trans-unit.source: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This article assumes that you have already installed an Oracle Linux operating system to a virtual hard disk.
trans-unit.target: This article assumes that you have already installed an Oracle Linux operating system to a virtual hard disk.

trans-unit.source: Multiple tools exist to create .vhd files, for example a virtualization solution such as Hyper-V.
trans-unit.target: Multiple tools exist to create .vhd files, for example a virtualization solution such as Hyper-V.

trans-unit.source: Oracle Linux Installation Notes
trans-unit.target: Oracle Linux Installation Notes

trans-unit.source: Oracle's Red Hat compatible kernel and their UEK3 (Unbreakable Enterprise Kernel) are both supported on Hyper-V and Azure.
trans-unit.target: Oracle's Red Hat compatible kernel and their UEK3 (Unbreakable Enterprise Kernel) are both supported on Hyper-V and Azure.

trans-unit.source: For best results, please be sure to update to the latest kernel while preparing your Oracle Linux VHD.
trans-unit.target: For best results, please be sure to update to the latest kernel while preparing your Oracle Linux VHD.

trans-unit.source: Oracle's UEK2 is not supported on Hyper-V and Azure as it does not include the required drivers.
trans-unit.target: Oracle's UEK2 is not supported on Hyper-V and Azure as it does not include the required drivers.

trans-unit.source: The newer VHDX format is not supported in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The newer VHDX format is not supported in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can convert the disk to VHD format using Hyper-V Manager or the convert-vhd cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: You can convert the disk to VHD format using Hyper-V Manager or the convert-vhd cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: When installing the Linux system it is recommended that you use standard partitions rather than LVM (often the default for many installations).
trans-unit.target: When installing the Linux system it is recommended that you use standard partitions rather than LVM (often the default for many installations).

trans-unit.source: This will avoid LVM name conflicts with cloned VMs, particularly if an OS disk ever needs to be attached to another VM for troubleshooting.
trans-unit.target: This will avoid LVM name conflicts with cloned VMs, particularly if an OS disk ever needs to be attached to another VM for troubleshooting.

trans-unit.source: LVM or [RAID](virtual-machines-linux-configure-raid.md) may be used on data disks if preferred.
trans-unit.target: LVM or [RAID](virtual-machines-linux-configure-raid.md) may be used on data disks if preferred.

trans-unit.source: NUMA is not supported for larger VM sizes due to a bug in Linux kernel versions below 2.6.37.
trans-unit.target: NUMA is not supported for larger VM sizes due to a bug in Linux kernel versions below 2.6.37.

trans-unit.source: This issue primarily impacts distributions using the upstream Red Hat 2.6.32 kernel.
trans-unit.target: This issue primarily impacts distributions using the upstream Red Hat 2.6.32 kernel.

trans-unit.source: Manual installation of the Azure Linux agent (waagent) will automatically disable NUMA in the GRUB configuration for the Linux kernel.
trans-unit.target: Manual installation of the Azure Linux agent (waagent) will automatically disable NUMA in the GRUB configuration for the Linux kernel.

trans-unit.source: More information about this can be found in the steps below.
trans-unit.target: More information about this can be found in the steps below.

trans-unit.source: Do not configure a swap partition on the OS disk.
trans-unit.target: Do not configure a swap partition on the OS disk.

trans-unit.source: The Linux agent can be configured to create a swap file on the temporary resource disk.
trans-unit.target: The Linux agent can be configured to create a swap file on the temporary resource disk.

trans-unit.source: More information about this can be found in the steps below.
trans-unit.target: More information about this can be found in the steps below.

trans-unit.source: All of the VHDs must have sizes that are multiples of 1 MB.
trans-unit.target: All of the VHDs must have sizes that are multiples of 1 MB.

trans-unit.source: Both the Red Hat compatible kernel and Oracle's UEK3 are supported in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Both the Red Hat compatible kernel and Oracle's UEK3 are supported in Azure.

trans-unit.source: The UEK3 kernel is recommended.

trans-unit.target: XFS is now the default file system.

trans-unit.source: The ext4 file system can still be used if desired.
